titles.title: Ano Hi no Kanojo-tachi
ナナブンノニジュウニ
あの日の彼女たち
The Diary of Our Days
Nanabun no Nijuuni
22/7 (Nanabun no Nijyuuni)

anime.description: * 22/7 (nanabun no nijyuuni) is a digital idol and voice actors` project produced by famed producer http://anidb.net/cr4528 [Akimoto Yasushi]. One day, http://anidb.net/ch106390 [Takigawa Miu] suddenly receives a letter notifying her that she has been chosen as a member of a brand-new project. Half in disbelief, she heads over to the location stated on the letter. There, she finds seven other girls summoned there in the same fashion. The girls behold a giant, top-secret facility. They stand in bewilderment as they are told: "You are going to debut for a major record label as an idol group." A new kind of idol, never-before-seen, is about to be born here... Source: Official website

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Tokyo
tag.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government. Tokyo is in the Kantou region on the southeastern side of the main island Honshu and includes the Izu Islands and Ogasawara Islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: performance
tag.description: The song performance on stage or acting in a theatre is a central part of the character`s life in this anime type.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: occupation and career
tag.description: The kind of anime which shows the career of a character, usually from the beginning.

tag.name: entertainment industry
tag.description: The show depicts how the entertainment industry works and how the main protagonists strive to cope with the sudden change to fame. At times this can be a very ugly sight indeed.

tag.name: dialogue driven
tag.description: A dialogue driven show has its story advanced by dialogue, with action being of much lower priority, and relies heavily on conversations between characters.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: OP and ED sung by characters
tag.description: OP and/or ED in this anime is sung by the characters and animation shows them singing.

tag.name: narration
tag.description: The most common example is that of a voice, either that of one of the characters or entirely unrelated, that appears at the beginning of an episode to offer a summary or introduction, and at the end of an episode for closure or for a preview to hint upon what to expect next. Another use of narration comes in the form of a dominant voice belonging to one of the protagonists, intended only for the viewer and revealing the intimate thoughts to whom it belongs. This type of narration occurs frequently throughout the duration of the episode or movie.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: mystery
tag.description: The mystery film is a sub-genre of the more general category of crime film. It focuses on the efforts of the detective, private investigator or amateur sleuth to solve the mysterious circumstances of a crime by means of clues, investigation, and clever deduction. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: cute girls doing cute things
tag.description:
Cute girls doing cute things with each other (CGDCT): when girls are super friendly with each other and do all sorts of http://anidb.net/t798 [cute/moe] things with each other, but there is no yuri or shoujo ai subtext -- more specifically, there is no romantic subtext.
* CGDCT applies where the main focus is on moe/cute girls and their interactions with each other. Good examples include http://anidb.net/a9722 [Non Non Biyori] (600 weight / 3.0 stars) and http://anidb.net/a9579 [Kin`iro Mosaic] (600 weight / 3.0 stars). * Generally, CGDCT is applicable only if the anime is also tagged predominantly female cast or all female cast. * CGDCT does not apply if girls doing cute things is incidental to a larger motive/theme/meta. For example, in http://anidb.net/a8168 [Nichijou] the focus is comedy, using cute girls; the tag would not apply.
CGDCT is often mistaken as low level yuri or shoujo ai. If there is also actual romantic subtext, use the http://anidb.net/t2695 [yuri (18+)] and http://anidb.net/t2782 [shoujo ai] tags as well. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

character.name: Maruyama Akane
character.description: Reticent and always level-headed. She has very few emotional swings and thinks rationally at all times, so people around her think she is like a robot. She is good at cooking, and her hobby is to collect bath salts. Source: Official English website

character.name: Satou Reika
character.description: A model student that is honest and hates anything crooked. An unreliable father has had some effect in shaping her personality. She is usually a responsible girl, but sometimes she can act airheaded, and people tease her for that. Source: Official English website

character.name: Toda Jun
character.description: An overwhelmingly bright girl. Oftentimes she goes too far and people feel she is an idiot. She has her childish sides, but she`s always true to her heart and tries her best in everything she does. Loves fried food and sweets. Source: Official English website

character.name: Saitou Nicole
character.description: A stoic, hard worker. She makes a daily effort to become the ideal idol that she envisions in her mind. She is harsh on herself as well as others, and sometimes sounds harsh when talking to those around her. Her favorite animal is a rabbit. Source: Official English website

character.name: Kouno Miyako
character.description: A bright, energetic, talkative girl from Osaka. Oldest of seven, she takes good care of her siblings. A mood-setter. Loves comedy shows and she can be both the comic or the straight man. Her favorite food is okonomiyaki (Japanese savory pancake). Source: Official English website

character.name: Takigawa Miu
character.description: Introverted and not good at conversing with others. Due to her slightly awkward personality, she has problems smiling in front of the customers at her part-time job. Thinks dearly of her mother and little sister. Source: Official English website

character.name: Tachikawa Ayaka
character.description: Youngest of three sisters. Her older sisters have caused her to be a bit more philosophical. She forges her own path and remain unaffected by others. She has a strong will, but also has a side that looks out after others. She is the most charismatic one of the group. Source: Official English website

character.name: Fujima Sakura
character.description: A girl who grew up in Los Angeles. Good with English, but terrible with Japanese kanji. Since she was raised by her grandmother in place of her parents who were busy with work, she is very close to her grandmother. Her favorite food is smashed cucumbers with plum dressing. Source: Official English website

character.name: Kamiki Mikami
character.description: With an easygoing personality and impossible to anger, she does everything at her own pace. Mikami comes from a wealthy Kyoto family, and her strict upbringing has made her both polite and elegant. She is also a bird-lover. Source: Official English website

character.name: Toujou Yuuki
character.description: An outspoken, athletic girl and a tomboy to the core. She has trouble trying to play at being cute. She is great at sports, with soccer as her favorite. Source: Official English website

character.name: Hiiragi Tsubomi
character.description: Carefree and fun-loving, Tsubomi is always up for anything. She has a gift for forgetting about her bad experiences almost the instant they’re over. Tsubomi claims to be a “gyaru” who was born in Shibuya and raised in Harajuku. Her favorite food are sweet pastries. Source: Official English website

character.name: Kouno Isamu
character.description: One of http://anidb.net/character/106389 [Kouno Miyako]`s younger brothers.

character.name: Kouno Takeru
character.description: One of http://anidb.net/character/106389 [Kouno Miyako]`s younger brothers.

character.name: Kouno Kaoru
character.description: One of http://anidb.net/character/106389 [Kouno Miyako]`s younger sisters.

character.name: Kouno Yuki
character.description: One of http://anidb.net/character/106389 [Kouno Miyako]`s younger sisters.

character.name: Kabe-chan
character.description: The physical representation of the Wall.

episode.title: さよなら, 私のささやかな世界
Goodbye Small World
Sayonara, Watashi no Sasayaka na Sekai
episode.summary: Miu Takigawa receives a suspicious letter from talent agency, G.I.P. Eight young girls including Miu are brought together by the hands of fate. The letter says, “You will be joining an idol group and debuting on a major label.” A man named Aida takes them to a top-secret underground facility with a mysterious “wall.” Miu and the girls experience a whirlwind of light and darkness as they make their way to the stage… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: めまいの真ん中
Amid the Dizziness
Memai no Mannaka
episode.summary: Two new plates have emerged from the Wall. The first is the name of Miu’s idol group, “22/7,” and the second instructs the staff to conduct a group evaluation. Amid the confusion, each member prepares for the assessment; however, Miu falls into despair as she is unable to imagine herself as an idol. With tensions running high, a panel of strict judges convenes to evaluate each girl. Nicole stands out above the rest with her excellent performance, but Miu is unable to even properly introduce herself… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: こんにちは, 新しい世界
Hello New World
Konnichiwa, Atarashii Sekai
episode.summary: The Wall issues an order announcing that 22/7’s debut show will be on February 27th. Miu and the girls engage in grueling rehearsals every day to prepare for the show. Even though Miu was chosen as the center, she lags behind and slows down the progress of the group. What can Miu do as the center of 22/7? The day of the show arrives. What Miu sees from the stage is way beyond her expectations. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束に咲く花
The Promised Flower
Yakusoku ni Saku Hana
episode.summary: After 22/7’s successful debut show, the Wall issues a new order: “Have a successful gravure photo shoot at the Hitome Senbonzakura cherry blossoms.” Gouda and the staff scramble to book a cover photo shoot with a magazine to fulfill the unreasonable request from the Wall; however, Sakura is overcome with emotion. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アニメ「ナナブンノニジュウニ」放送直前リハーサル
Episode S1
Anime "Nanabun no Nijyuuni" Housou Chokuzen Rehearsal
ひっくり返せばええねんで!
Just Flip It Over!
Hikkurikaeseba Ee Nende!
episode.summary: The Wall issues a new order instructing the girls to perform at ITF (Idol Tokyo Festival), known as a stepping-stone to success for idols. This is the first festival appearance for 22/7, but after seeing other idol groups they realize that they lack cohesiveness. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 偶数と奇数のあいだ
Between the Even and Odd Numbers
Guusuu to Kisuu no Aida
episode.summary: The Wall suddenly issues an order stating that, “The leader of the group is Reika Sato.” Having a strong sense of responsibility, Reika worries about her newly appointed position. The Wall issues another order instructing 22/7 to fly to Okinawa to shoot images for a photo book. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハッピー☆ジェット☆コースター
Happy Jet Coaster
Happy Jet Coaster
episode.summary: Many members of the group have collapsed due to exhaustion. 22/7 has been inundated with bookings and their schedule is full again today. In this urgent situation, the only member that is fine is Jun. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゆめみるロボット
Dreaming Robot
Yumemiru Robot
episode.summary: 22/7 has been booked for a huge headliner show and the group is in good spirits. While the girls are visibly excited about their upcoming show, Akane is calm and collected as usual, even almost robot-like. What inspired her to become an idol? Source: AnimeLab

episode.title: お星さまのララバイ
Lullaby of the Stars
Ohoshisama no Lullaby
episode.summary: With the success of their headliner show, everything seems to be going well for 22/7 as they are approaching their fist anniversary. As a reward for their hard work, the Wall gives the members a two day trip to a hot spring. Source: AnimeLab

episode.title: さよなら, 私たちの世界
Goodbye to Our World
Sayonara, Watashitachi no Sekai
episode.summary: The Wall suddenly issues an order for 22/7 to disband. Miu and the girls are frozen in disbelief and even Gouda can’t hide his confusion, but the orders from The Wall are absolute. The management is forced to close their office and 22/7 holds a press conference announcing their breakup. Source: AnimeLab

episode.title: ただその背中を追いつづけて
Chasing Our Dreams
Tada Sono Senaka o Oitsuzukete
episode.summary: 22/7 has disbanded based on the orders from the Wall. The GIP office has shut down and all the members have gone their separate ways. Nicole had the strongest ambition to become an idol and is furious about this outcome. Source: AnimeLab

episode.title: ナナブンノニジュウニ
22/7 (Nanabun no Nijyuuni)
Nanabun no Nijyuuni
episode.summary: After the eight members of 22/7 gather and confirm their love for the group again, the Wall, which had been silent since the disbandment press conference, starts to speak again. Source: AnimeLab
